bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence T. Royster to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1947

div1.p: Royster is sorry that he had to miss Hench's lecture, and sends Hench a reprint which may be of interest.[not enclosed]

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence T. Royster to Philip Showalter Hench, November 20, 1947
div1.opener:
LAWRENCE T. ROYSTER, M. D.
BOX 1335, UNIVERSITY STATION
CHARLOTTESVILLE, VIRGINIA
November 20, 1947
Dr. Philip Hench
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I regret very much
that I could not hear you
speak before the medical soc-
iety here, but I have not been
well for a year or more and
have stopped going out at night.
I retired from my professorship
six years ago.

I am flattering my-
self in thinking that you
would be interrested in the
reprint which I am sending.

I hope that some-
time in the future it maybe
my pleasure to meet you.

Very Cordially,
L. T. Royster
per F. J.

New Orleans Med J
Nov 1916
re Fulgs Speed
